thread.title: AU rally falls short against Mount St. Joseph
thread.title_full: AU rally falls short against Mount St. Joseph

author: Mike Battreall | For The Herald Bulletin
title: AU rally falls short against Mount St. Joseph
text:
LOGO AU ATHLETICS Posted: Saturday, October 10, 2015 7:04 pm AU rally falls short against Mount St. Joseph By Mike Battreall | For The Herald Bulletin Herald Bulletin 
ANDERSON — Anderson University's women's soccer team could extend neither its scoreless streak by opponents nor victory string Saturday against Mount St. Joseph. 
The Ravens, however, did not go down 3-2 without putting up a tussle with the Lions. 
After a rather sluggish first half, Anderson gained energy and evened the count at 2-2 late in the second half but surrendered the game-winning goal in the 87th minute and went down to its first Heartland Collegiate Athletic Conference defeat. 
Anderson, which took a two-game win streak into Saturday's contest — having blanked HCAC foes Earlham and Bluffton — fell to 6-4 overall and 2-1 in the league. 
"We told them that the second half was a new half, and we (need to) start with intensity and just start from the beginning, going and pressing at them," Ravens' coach Jennifer Myhre said. "And what a way to respond, coming from down 2-0 and getting two back. And that's huge for our team." 
The Ravens moved forward from an opening half that saw them allow goals by Maggie Tidwell and Kaylan Gruber and manage only three shots themselves. 
While it took a bit more time for goals to show up, the intent was there from the start of the second half. Beverly Brittingham launched a solid shot — one of four from her on the day — right at MSJ goalkeeper Lindsey Sturwold in the 50th minute. 
Anderson finally broke through in the 78th minute, when Halley Embree took a pass from Hannah Wegley from about 15 yards out and rifled it home. It was Embree's team-leading fourth goal of the season. 
In the 84th minute, Tiffany Simcox weaved around a Lions defender and fired a shot that Sturwold deflected. Katie Frazer was there for the rebound, and the contest was tied. 
MSJ surged back in front three minutes later, and to stay, on Gruber's second goal of the game, as she dribbled by Destiny Crawford and beat keeper Allyson Saylor. 
"It's unfortunate (the Lions got) a lucky break at the end," Myhre said. "The team battled hard, and the back line was strong. I'm pleased with the fight and the effort, but we got an unlucky break, and it was unfortunate we couldn't pull it off." 
MSJ (7-4-1, 2-1 HCAC) had a 14-10 shot advantage, but the Ravens had seven in the second half to five for the Lions. Saylor was credited with eight saves. 
"We still continue to fight and battle hard," Myhre said. "Hopefully this will carry this fight into our next game. There are a lot more games left to play. So we've got to take it one game at a time. It's one bump on the road, but we'll build back on it and get the next one." 
Anderson plays Defiance on Wednesday at Macholtz Stadium at 7 p.m. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
